TITLE.P: SCC LP Orbis Planned Maintenance Works Framework

SHORT_DESCR.P: Surrey County Council on behalf of the Orbis Partnership is seeking to establish a Framework for the delivery of Planned Maintenance Works. The Contracting Authorities manage and maintain a large portfolio of property. The prime aim of this Framework Agreement is to facilitate the following works:
— mechanical Services (Including Air Conditioning),
— electrical Services,
— doors and Windows,
— roofing,
— general Building Works (Including Kitchens refurbishment and renewals),
— asbestos Removal Works,

— display Energy Certificates (DEC) and Energy Performance Certificates (EPC). The Framework is intended to be in place for an initial term of 3 years with an option to extend it to 4th year. No value, volume of work or exclusivity is implied or guaranteed under this Framework.

TITLE.P: Mechanical Services (Including Air Conditioning) - Works up to c.100 000 GBP - BHCC

SHORT_DESCR.P: Mechanical Services (Including Air Conditioning) — Works up to c.100 000 GBP in Brighton and Hove. Annual Indicative Spend 400 - 450 K GBP.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: This Framework will be for a period of 36 months with the option of extension up to a further 12 months.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Mechanical Services (Including Air Conditioning) - Works up to c.£100,000 in East Sussex. Annual Indicative Spend £500-750K.

SUITABILITY.P: As stated in the procurement documents.

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: The Framework will be for a period of 36 months with the option of extension for a further 12 months

INFO_ADD_EAUCTION.P: The Contracting Authority reserves the right to use an electronic auction option during the procurement process.

INFO_ADD.P: Orbis is a partnership between Brighton and Hove City Council, East Sussex County Council and Surrey County Council that aims to provide seamless and resilient business services to the public sector, creating a compelling alternative to other providers. This tender is to be completed electronically using the SE Shared Services Procurement eSourcing portal. http://www.sesharedservices.org.uk/esourcing The following authorities, in addition to Surrey County Council, shall be Participating Authorities for the purposes of this Framework Agreement and shall be entitled to place an Order with the Service Provider at their discretion upon completion of an Access Agreement:
3) All district and borough in East Sussex as named below; Eastbourne Borough Council Hastings Borough Council Lewes District Council Rother District Council Wealden District Council;

4) All district and borough councils in Surrey as named below; Elmbridge Borough Council Epsom and Ewell Borough Council Guildford Borough Council Mole Valley District Council Reigate and Banstead Borough Council Runnymede Borough Council Spelthorne Borough Council Surrey Heath Borough Council Tandridge District Council Waverley Borough Council Woking Borough Council;

5) All maintained schools, Academies and Free Schools in: East Sussex: https://apps.eastsussex.gov.uk/educationandlearning/schools/schoolsearch/search.aspx Surrey: http://www.surreycc.gov.uk/schools-and-learning/schools/directory-of-surrey-schools Brighton Hove: http://ww3.brighton-hove.gov.uk/index.cfm?request=c1001684&node=20506;

6) Higher and Further Education establishments with sites in Surrey, East Sussex and Brighton and Hove as described in: http://www.hefce.ac.uk/workprovide/unicoll/fecs/ and http://www.hefce.ac.uk/workprovide/unicoll/heis/;
7) Police Authorities as described below: Surrey Police Authority Sussex Police Authority;
8) Fire and Rescue Services as described below: East Sussex Fire and Rescue Service Surrey Fire and Rescue Service;
9) Ambulance Services as described below: South East Coast Ambulance Service South Central Ambulance Service;

10) All Town and Parish Councils in: East Sussex: https://new.eastsussex.gov.uk/yourcouncil/about/howthecouncilworks/parishtowncouncils Surrey: https://www.surreycc.gov.uk/your-council/councillors-and-committees/district-borough-and-parish-councillors/parish-and-town-council-websites;
11) Voluntary and Community Organisations with a presence in Surrey, East Sussex, as described in: http://www.charitycommission.gov.uk/Showcharity/RegisterOfCharities/AdvancedSearch.aspx;

12) Housing Associations with a presence in Surrey, East Sussex, as described in: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/current-registered-providers-of-social-housing This list is intended to list major organisations. This list is not exhaustive or definitive for the duration of the Framework Agreement. Other, smaller, organisations may also use the services where such organisations use services for the delivery of public services in Surrey, East Sussex and Brighton and Hove.
